channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Looks like contents froze and some came through the cap, package was put into a black bin with a plastic bag to contain. DescribePack: Liquid from bottles is now a powder all over the inside of the box and on the outside of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a black bin with a plastic bag to contain.

item.title: Report X-2024021587
item.description:
Report X-2024021587

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: UNIONDALE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN NASSAU, NEW YORK, SMOKE WAS OBSERVED EMITTING FROM A ONE POUND FIBERBOARD BOX. EMPLOYEES WERE EVACUATED FROM THE AREA AND THE PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED OUTSIDE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS VISIBLE ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS AN APPLIED LABEL STATING "DO NOT THROW AWAY THIS BOX. PLEASE PLACE THE CAMERA BACK IN THIS BOX AFTER REMOVING IT FROM THE WALL". "KEPLER ANALYTICS" IS ALSO INDICATED ON ONE SIDE OF THE BOX. THE EVENT HAS CAUSED ONE SIDE OF THE BOX TO HAVE A BURN HOLE WITH SCORCH MARKS SURROUNDING. THERE ARE VISIBLE CHAR AND SCORTCH MARKS ON ANOTHER SIDE OF THE BOX. INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENT REVEALS SOME TYPE OF CAMERA WITH AN UNKNOWN BATTERY SOURCE THAT IS ALMOST ENTIRELY DESTROYED. PRIOR TO THE INCIDENT, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM FT LAUDERDALE (FLL) TO LOUISVILLE (SDF) TO NEW YORK (JFK). AS REQUIRED PER 171.15 A TELEPHONE NOTICE WAS MADE TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER (NRC). REPORT NUMBER 1392059.

item.title: Report X-2024021746
item.description:
Report X-2024021746

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T00:27:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being off loaded from a trailer when it was dropped, and the container was punctured causing a leak. Cardboard and absorbent were placed down to absorb the liquid and the pail was placed inside a salvage drum. DescribePack: The container has a nickel size puncture hole on the side of it where it was dropped.. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the liquid started to appear on the floor cardboard and absorbent were placed down. The container was immediately placed inside a salvage drum.
